main event: A round, yellowish object with a flashing light was observed for 30 minutes on 10 December 1957.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 30 minutes over Lake Koshkonong., The object was identified as a balloon released from La Crosse, WI., Winds were approximately 40-45 MPH which could have carried the balloon., The distance to the observer was approximately 110 miles., The color of the object and the flashing light were notable features during the observation.
sighted object: round, yellowish object with a flashing light
